bibl.title: Letter from Melvin D. Brewer to Philip Showalter Hench, October 9, 1940

div1.p: Brewer requests a copy of Hench's speech for publication in newspapers.

div1.head: Letter from Melvin D. Brewer to Philip Showalter Hench, October 9, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE ALUMNI ASSOCIATION
OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
October 9, 1940

div1.p:
In order to publicize our Founders' Day
fully both before and after it has taken place,
we would like to have a copy of the speech which
you intend to deliver at the Founders' Day dinner.
Will your speech be available for our publicity
department within the next few days?

Of course, it will not be released
until the day it is given but we would like to
have it beforehand so that it can be made ready
for publication in the Sunday newspapers on
October 27th.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, M. D. Brewer
Alumni Secretary Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
